subject: Real Estate
title: Las Vegas Strip: From Desert to Gold Mine
description: A 60-second lesson on Las Vegas Strip: From Desert to Gold Mine.

hook.text: In 1941, the El Rancho Vegas opened on a dusty highway outside town. It was the Strip's first casino hotel.

buildup.text: Bugsy Siegel's Flamingo opened in 1946, proving that luxury gambling could thrive in the desert.

discovery.text: Each new casino tried to outdo the last. The Strip became an arms race of spectacle and excess.

twist.text: Steve Wynn's Mirage in 1989 cost $630 million and transformed the Strip into a family entertainment destination.

climax.text: The Las Vegas Strip now generates $8 billion annually. Its land value exceeds Manhattan's per square foot.

punchline.text: The most valuable land in America sits in a desert.

quiz.question: What did Steve Wynn's Mirage do for the Las Vegas Strip?
options: Transformed it into a family entertainment destination
